business.headline: ITR filing: Why you should declare foreign assets by January 15Indian residents must disclose foreign assets and income in their ITRs by January 15, 2025, to maintain compliance and avoid penalties.

EPFO 3.0 launch date announced: Check ATM withdrawal feature, other detailsEPFO 3.0, launching by June 2025, will offer ATM-based withdrawals, flexible contributions, and improved features, transforming retirement fund management.

IT giant Infosys defers annual salary hikes to Q4. 3 reasons whyInfosys postpones annual salary hike: The ongoing macroeconomic uncertainty has left IT companies grappling with subdued discretionary spending, delayed client budgets, and rising cost pressures.
Sensex slides 1,200 points as HMPV scare derails Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 1258.12 points to close at 77,964.99, while the NSE Nifty50 nosedived 388.70 points to end at 23,616.05.

Table Space co-founder Amit Banerji dies of heart attackAmit Banerji, founder and CEO of Table Space, passed away suddenly at 44, leaving a lasting impact on the startup ecosystem and his company's growth.

Ritesh Agarwal explains how OYO is shifting focus to family-friendly staysKnown for being couple-friendly, even for unmarried couples, OYO has been working over the past few months to rebrand itself as a more family-oriented platform.
Budget 2025: Will salaried class get any tax relief?With Budget 2025 approaching, the salaried class eagerly anticipates a budget that acknowledges their contributions and eases financial burdens.

Standard Glass Lining IPO fully booked on Day 1: Should you subscribe or skip?Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1: Investors have shown huge interest in the Standard Glass Lining IPO and on its opening day, the IPO was subscribed 7.43 times overall as of latest update.

Why did Sensex, Nifty crash today? 5 reasons why stock market is down Share market crash today: Sensex and Nifty tumbled sharply during the trading session as Dalal Street saw a massive spike in volatility. Below are the key factors that have negatively impacted the stock market today.

Explained: Why Union Bank share price tumbled 7% after Q3 updateUnion Bank stock price: The decline followed a weak quarter-on-quarter (Q-o-Q) performance in its Q3 update. By 1:09 pm, the stock was trading 6.69% lower at Rs 115.75 on the BSE.

Capital Infra Trust IPO: Check latest GMP, price band, and key datesCapital Infra Trust InvIT IPO: The IPO allotment is scheduled for January 10, 2025, with refunds expected to be processed by January 13. Shares will likely be credited to demat accounts on the same day, and the listing is anticipated on January 14 on the BSE and NSE.

ITR filing: 5 new tax regime features every taxpayer must knowBudget 2024's revamped tax regime offers simplified slabs, higher deductions, and savings up to Rs 17,500 annually, enhancing flexibility and easing tax compliance for taxpayers.

Saregama India share price surges over 20% in 5 days. Should you buy or avoid?Saregama India stock price opened at Rs 537.95 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and climbed to an intraday high of Rs 593 before stabilising around Rs 568 at 12:27 PM, up 3% for the day.
Budget 2025: 7 ways government can boost employmentAs the budget approaches, several measures have been proposed to boost job creation and improve productivity.

Explained: Why Easy Trip Planners share price jumped up to 17% todayEasy Trip Planners' stock price hit an intraday high of Rs 17.84 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, reflecting a 17.67% jump from its previous close. At 11:23 am, the stock traded at Rs 16.56, up 6.70%.

Sensex nosedives 1,200 points: 3 key reasons behind bloodbath on Dalal StreetStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 1165.74 points to 78,057.37, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 366.85 points to 23,637.90 as of 12:02 PM.

Top stock picks for 2025: Paytm, Infosys in focus with gains of up to 46%From IT giant Infosys to fintech leader Paytm, the brokerage firm has outlined stocks that could deliver good returns. If you've been waiting for the next big idea to boost your portfolio, this list might just be your guide.

Explained: Why ITC share price fell by 6% todayITC stock price: ITC hotels demerger process begins. A special pre-open session was conducted on the stock exchanges between 9:00 AM and 9:45 AM to determine ITC Hotels' share price.
Do banks owe you money? Check unclaimed deposits via UDGAM portalRBI (Reerve Bank of India) launched the Unclaimed Deposits – Gateway to Access Information (UDGAM) portal in August 2023.
Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by IT stocks; Titan gains 2% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 254.19 points to 79,477.30, while NSE Nifty50 gained 61.50 points to 24,066.25 as of 9:23 AM.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Multiple earthquakes strike Tibet, tremors felt in several parts of IndiaTremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and many parts of North India on Tuesday following a 7.1 magnitude earthquake in Tibet, near the Nepal border.

Canada PM Justin Trudeau says he'll resign after new Liberal party leader namedDescribing himself as "a fighter who cares for his country," Justin Trudeau announced his decision to resign after nine years in office. He cited the need for party leadership renewal amid mounting internal pressure and growing voter dissatisfaction.

HMPV not a new virus, no reason to worry: Government as 5 cases reportedUnion Health Minister JP Nadda, in a video message, said that India's health systems and surveillance networks are vigilant to ensure a prompt response to any emerging health challenges due to Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV).

Ajit Pawar scolds NCP workers: 'You voted for me but you're not my boss' At an event to inaugurate a petrol pump in Medad village, Pawar grew visibly irritated when workers attempted to hand him memorandums mid-speech.
Zendaya and Tom Holland are engaged: ReportActors Zendaya and Tom Holland are reportedly engaged. According to sources, the Spider-Man star proposed to Zendaya during an intimate holiday gathering.

BJP arrested Arvind Kejriwal to stall AAP's work in Delhi: Atishi to India TodaySpeaking to India Today TV, Chief Minister Atishi slammed the BJP for hindering work in Delhi by arresting top leaders, challenging saffron party-ruled states to match AAP's achievements.

Who will replace Trudeau as Canada PM, Indian-origin Anita Anand among contendersDespite his announcement to resign on Monday, the 53-year-old embattled leader confirmed he would remain in office until the ruling Liberal Party chooses his successor. Canada's parliament will also remain suspended until March 24.

Video: AAP leader flogs himself for failing to get justice under 'corrupt' BJP ruleWhile addressing a gathering in Surat, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Gopal Italia flogged himself with a belt for "failing to ensure justice" for the victims of various crimes committed in Gujarat.

HMPV scare: Your detailed guideHuman metapneumovirus (HMPV) is garnering attention due to rising cases in China and advisories in Indian states like Karnataka and Maharashtra. While it's not a new virus, concerns are heightened because of limited research and public awareness. Here's everything you need to know about the virus.

Trudeau knew this and resigned: What Trump said after Canadian PM's moveTrump revived his pitch to make Canada the 51st US state after Trudeau's resignation, sparking debate over trade, security, and sovereignty. Canadian officials remain silent on the bold proposal.

Smith attributes missing out on 10,000 Test runs milestone to tough SCG pitchVeteran Australian batter Steve Smith has opened up on narrowly missing reaching the milestone of 10,000 career runs during the five-match Test series against India for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

UK PM responds to Elon Musk's grooming gang charge: 'Lies and misinformation'At a presser, Keir Starmer refused to address Elon Musk by name but directly tackled the claims. He described his efforts as Britain's top prosecutor to bring justice in cases involving grooming gangs.

Payal Kapadia's first reaction to All We Imagine As Light's Golden Globes snubDirector Payal Kapadia's critically-acclaimed film, All We Imagine As Light, was nominated in two categories at the recently concluded Golden Globes. However, the film lost out on awards. Payal Kapadia took it in her stride and reacted to it on her Instagram Stories.

US judge denies Donald Trump's plea to delay sentencing in hush money caseUS President-elect Donald Trump will be required to appear at a court hearing in a case involving hush money paid to a porn star.

After Dhanush, Chandramukhi makers sue Nayanthara for Rs 5 crore over documentaryNayanthara is reportedly entangled in a legal dispute, with the makers of Chandramukhi filing a lawsuit over the alleged use of clips in her Netflix documentary. This development adds to her growing legal challenges.

Why HMPV is unlikely to cause a new pandemicIndia has detected three cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), a respiratory virus similar to Covid-19 that spreads through droplets and affects vulnerable groups.

Winter storm paralyses US with snow, power outages, and travel disruptionsWinter storm in the US have triggered states of emergency in seven states, caused over 1,300 flight cancellations, and left 250,000 homes and businesses without power. Heavy snowfall, freezing temperatures, and Arctic air are creating hazardous conditions, with snowfall in Washington, DC, expected to reach up to 16 inches. Residents are urged to stay indoors and take precautions.
How to onboard Indian men into family planningThe 2030 Family Planning Vision aims to make engaging men a policy priority to abate worries on female sterilisation

Infants at risk from HMPV: Top questions answeredSpeaking to India Today TV, renowned paediatrician Dr Krishna Chugh addressed key concerns about HMPV, focusing on its potential risks to infants and precautions that parents can take against the virus spread.

9 trapped in flooded rat-hole mine in Assam, rescue operation launchedA joint operation has been launched by specialised teams from the Army, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) and the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) to rescue the workers.

Video: Isro demonstrates tethered debris capture in spaceIsro's SpaDeX mission achieved a major milestone with its robotic arm demonstrating tethered debris capture in space, showcasing advanced technology for debris management and spacecraft refuelling.

Watch: Demi Moore's daughters have the best reaction to her Golden Globes winActor Demi Moore's daughters had an unforgettable reaction to her first-ever Golden Globes win. In a now-viral video, they are seen shouting and jumping with joy as actor Kerry Washington announced Demi's name as the winner.

US Congress certifies Trump election victory with Kamala Harris presiding houseThe quadrennial ritual, clearing the way for Trump's inauguration in two weeks, went like clockwork and stood in sharp contrast to four years ago when a mob of Trump supporters stormed the Capitol in a failed bid to block the certification of then-President Trump's 2020 loss to Democratic President Joe Biden.

Air pollution bigger threat than cancer? Age-reversing CEO sounds alarmIndia's air pollution levels contribute to nearly 1.67 million premature deaths annually, as per a study published in the Lancet Planetary Health. Diseases linked to air pollution have outpaced cancer as the leading cause of death in India.

However, the film lost out on awards. Payal Kapadia took it in her stride and reacted to it on her Instagram Stories.
Zendaya and Tom Holland are engaged: ReportActors Zendaya and Tom Holland are reportedly engaged. According to sources, the Spider-Man star proposed to Zendaya during an intimate holiday gathering.

Sana Khan welcomes second child, a baby boy, with husband Anas SaiyadFormer actor Sana Khan welcomed her second child, a baby boy, with her businessman-husband Anas Saiyad. She shared a heart-warming post on Monday.

Monali Thakur shares 'unfortunate truth' about Varanasi concert: Deeply troublingSinger Monali Thakur broke her silence on the recent Varanasi concert, sharing a detailed note where she clarified the mismanagement. She also slammed the management team for the sexual harassment accusations levelled against her and her team.

sports.headline: Smith attributes missing out on 10,000 Test runs milestone to tough SCG pitchVeteran Australian batter Steve Smith has opened up on narrowly missing reaching the milestone of 10,000 career runs during the five-match Test series against India for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Babar Azam stepped up when we lost Saim: Shan Masood hails Pakistan's fightbackBabar Azam's resilience shone despite Pakistan's loss, with a stellar performance alongside Shan Masood. However, Masood emphasised the need for the team to capitalise on key moments, stressing the importance of learning to win in crucial situations.

Rampaging South Africa script fairy-tale comeback to confirm WTC top spot SA vs PAK: With their 10-wicket win over Pakistan in the New Year's Test, South Africa confirmed their top spot in the WTC 2023-25. South Africa started 2024 with three losses and a draw before going on a seven-match winning streak.

No mean feat: Temba Bavuma braces for WTC final vs AustraliaSA vs PAK: South African skipper Temba Bavuma said that the Proteas are ready to face Australia in the World Test Championship final. On Monday, South Africa beat Pakistan by 10 wickets in Cape Town to win the series 2-0.

Angelo Mathews slams ICC for Sri Lanka's limited 2025 Test schedule: ShockingAngelo Mathews calls out the ICC over Sri Lanka's dwindling Test opportunities, urging fairer scheduling to preserve the format's legacy. With just four Tests in 2025, Mathews fears disrupted careers and missed milestones as Sri Lanka's Test future hangs in the balance.

Konstas opens up on 'special' Test, recalls cousin, grandfather's death Border Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: Young Australian batter Sam Konstas said that the Pink Test holds a special place for him since the SCG Test helps in spreading awareness about cancer.

South Africa overcome Pakistan's stoic resistance to win New Year's Test, sweep series 2-0South Africa's dominance continues with a 10-wicket win over Pakistan, marking their seventh straight Test victory. Rickelton's double ton and Maharaj's key strikes shone, while Pakistan's valiant fight in the follow-on wasn't enough to avoid defeat.

Naomi Osaka 'optimistic' about Australian Open after painful Auckland exit  Naomi Osaka was confident of getting fit before the Australian Open after sustaining an abdominal injury that forced her out of the ASB Classic final against Clara Tauson on Sunday.

Ravi Shastri reveals admiration for Pat Cummins since coaching era: He amazes meRavi Shastri lauded Pat Cummins' captaincy after Australia's 3-1 BGT triumph, praising his competitive spirit and resilience. Shastri, recalling India's Test wins in Australia under his tenure, highlighted Cummins' determination and never-say-die attitude.

Hashmatullah hails Ismat Alams' ton on debut after Afghanistan's Test series winIsmat Alam's debut ton, honouring his father's legacy as an Afghan cricket pioneer, and Rashid Khan's match-winning brilliance powered Afghanistan to a historic Test series win over Zimbabwe.

Sumit Nagal valiant effort in vain, makes 1st round exit from ASB ClassicIn a gripping match, India's Sumit Nagal showed resilience but lost to USA's Alex Michelsen to make an early exit from the ASB Classic. Meanwhile, the Indo-Mexican duo of Balaji and Reyes-Varela pulled off a thrilling victory against Bopanna and Barrientos.

Australia's tactics to break Rohit Sharma empowered them: Kerry O'KeeffeBorder Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: Kerry O'Keeffe said that Australia could not take down Jasprit Bumrah, but were successfully able to break Indian captain Rohit Sharma in the five-match series.

Trent Alexander-Arnold unaffected by Real Madrid talk: Virgil van DijkLiverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has claimed that Trent Alexander-Arnold is unaffected by the talk around his future at the club as talks about a move to Real Madrid continue. Alexander-Arnold had a sloppy performance in the 2-2 draw against Manchester United at Anfield on January 5.

Shan Masood shatters 27-year-old record to make history for PakistanSA vs PAK, New Year's Test: Shan Masood scored 145 runs off 251 balls in the second Test against South Africa at the Newlands in Cape Town. Masood also shared a 205-run partnership with Babar Azam.

Meanwhile, transfer speculation continues to link Alexander-Arnold with a potential move to Real Madrid as his Anfield future remains uncertain.

Arundhati Reddy's snub since the Australia series has also come as a surprise.

They treat you like a liar: Iga Swiatek opens up on doping scandalIga Swiatek opened up on the tough times when she was serving her suspension after a failed doping test last year. Swiatek had tested positive for a banned substance, named trimetazidine, after which she missed three tournaments.

Malaysia Open 2025: All you need to know about the season openerSatwik-Chirag and Lakshya Sen will be leading the charge for India as the season-opening Malaysia Open 2025 gets underway on January 7. HS Prannoy, Treesa-Gayatri duo will also be in action during the tournament.

Jasprit Bumrah was used like you squeezed juice from sugarcane: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh slammed the Indian team management's handling of Jasprit Bumrah as the Indian pacer sustained an injury during the Sydney Test. Bumrah sustained back spasms during the final match of the series.

Watch: Assistant coach Dan Christian hits massive six in Big Bash LeagueDan Christian, at 41, rolled back the years with a stunning cameo of 23 runs, including two towering sixes, as he stepped out of retirement to bolster Sydney Thunder amidst an injury crisis, showcasing his enduring class and leadership.

Michael Vaughan and Usman Khawaja praise Yashasvi Jaiswal in Instagram commentsYashasvi Jaiswal's stellar debut tour of Australia earned praise from legends Michael Vaughan and Usman Khawaja. With 391 runs, including a stunning century in Perth, the young Indian batter showcased his grit and emerged as a future star.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
